gurmukhi: Axg isMG Aau AclsI Aimq isMG niRp qIr ]Amr isMG Ar AnGsI mhwN rQI rn DIr ]1136]
transliteration: Anag Singh Au Achalsiamit Singh Nrip Teer|| Amar Singh Ar Anaghsimahaan Rathiran Dheer||1136||
translation: The mighty warriors like Anag Singh, Achal Singh, Amit Singh, Amar Singh and Anagh Singh were sitting with the king Jarasandh.1136.

gurmukhi: dyK iqnY niRp isMDjrw hQIAwr Dry lKbIr pcwry ]pyKhu Awj AXoDn mY niRp pMc blI jdubIr sMGwry ]
transliteration: Dekh Tinai Nrip Sindh-jaraa Hathiaar Ddare Lakhbeer Pachdare Pekhoh Aaj Ayodhan Mai Nrip Panch Balijadoubeer Sanhdare||
translation: Seeing them with him, the king Jarasandh, looking at the weapons and these warriors said, “See, today in the battlefield, Krishna has killed five mighty kings;

gurmukhi: qw sMig jwie iBro qumhUM qij SMk inSMk bjwie ngwry ]Xo suin kY pRB kI bqIXw Aiq kop Bry rn Er pDwry ]1137]
transliteration: Taa San(i) Jaae Bhiro Toum-hoon Taj(i) Shank Nishank Bajaa Nagdare|| Yo Soun(i) Kai Prabh Kibateeyaa At(i) Kop Bhare Ran Or Badhdare||1137||
translation: “Now you may go and fight with him, beating your trumpets, without fear;” hearing these words of their king all marched towards the battlefield in great rage.1137

gurmukhi: Awvq hI jdubIr iqno rn BUm ibKY jm rUp inhwrXo ]pwn ghy Dn bwn soaU rn bIc iqno bldyv hkwrXo ]
transliteration: Oovat Hijadoubeer Tino Ran Bhoom Bikhai Jam Roop Nihdaryo|| Paan Gade Dhan Baan Sooo Ran Beech Tino Baldev Hakdaryo||
translation: When they came, Krishna saw them in the battlefield, wandering as the manifestation of Yama; they had caught hold of their bows and arrows in their hands and were challenging Balram;

gurmukhi: K`g ksy kit mY AMg kOc lIey brCw Axgys pukwrXo ]Awie iBro hirjU hm isau Ab TwFo khw ieh BwNiq aucwrXo ]1138]
transliteration: Khagg Kase Kattee Mai An Kaouch Leee Barchhaadanes Poukdaryo|| Ooe Bhiro Har(i)joo Ham Sio Ab Thaadho Kahaa Eh Bhaant(i) Ouchdaryo||1138||
translation: They had spears in their hands and armours were tightened on there limbs; Anag Singh, taking his lance in his hand, said loudly, “O Krishna ! why are you standing now?, come and have a fight with us.”1138.

gurmukhi: dyK qbY iqnko hirjU qb hI rn mY pMc bIr hkwry ]sXwm su sYn clXo ieq qyaU cly su bjwie ngwry ]
transliteration: Dekh Tabai Tinko Har(i)joo Tab Hiran Mai Panch Beer Hakdare|| Syaam Su Sain Chadyo It Te Out Teoo Chale Su Bajaae Nagdare||
translation: Krishna seeing those five warriors challenged them; from this side, Krishna moved with his arms and from the other side they also moved beating their trumpets;

gurmukhi: ptis loh hQI prsy AgnwXuD lY kir kop pHwry ]jUJ gey ieqky auqky Bt BUim igry su mno mqvwry ]1139]
transliteration: Patas(i) Loh Hathiparse Agnaayudh Lai Kar(i) Kop Prahdare|| Joojh Gad Itke Outke Bhat Bhoom(i) Gire Su Mano Matvdare||1139||
translation: Taking their steel-arms and fire arms, they began to strike blows in great fury; the warriors from both the sides fought fiercely and getting intoxicated, they began to fall on the ground.1139.

gurmukhi: ju`D BXo iqh Taur bfo ciF kY sB dyv ibbwnin Awey ]kauqik dyKn kau rn ko kib sXwm khY mn mod bFwey ]
transliteration: Jddh Bhayo Tih Thaur Bado Chadh(i) Kai Sabh Dev Bibaanan(i) Aae|| Kaoutak(i) Dekhan Kau Ran Ko Kabi Syaam Kahai Man Mod Badhaae||
translation: A dreadful war was fought; the gods saw it, sitting in their air-vehicles; their minds were excited to see the sport of war;

gurmukhi: lwgq swNgq ky Bt Xo igr Asvn qy DrnI pr Awey ]so iPr kY auT ju`Du krY iqhky gun ikMnr gMDRb gwey ]1140]
transliteration: Laagad Saanad Ke Bhat Yo Gir Asvan Te Dharnidar Aae|| So Phir Kai Outh Juddh(u) Darai Tih Ke Goun Kinnar Gaddhrab Gade||1140||
translation: On being struck by lances, the warriors fell down from their horses and writhed on the earth; the fallen warriors, getting up began to fight again and the Gandharavas and Kinnars sang their praises.1140.
